text: What would you say was the hardest part
about coping with with your son leaving?
It was difficult when uh he first was
deployed to Iraq.
We never were in the process of knowing
that he was going to go. It was like a
ripping, you know. I tried not to cry,
but my heart, my inner, it was just like
that's my baby.
It's hard job being the oldest head and
the man in the house.
But what's it like having the added
responsibility?
Horrible. Or just horrible. Ever since
my mom and dad broke up, it's just been
cleaning. It's just cleaning, cleaning,
cleaning.
Do you think it would help to have an
older brother?
Yes. Heck, I would be fine if I had a
twin brother if we both share a work.
It's tough because we during the off
season spend almost 24 hours a day
together. So then when the season
happens, I feel like, what am I going to
do with myself? I'm dreading the most
the fact that he has to be away from his
kids and that the kids are going to be
away from their father. It's hard to be
away from each other. It's hard.

I miss you so. Seems like it's been
forever that you've been gone.

Some days I want to quit and just be

career. Me and the rest of the family
here singing where you go.

Do you think it'd be easier if your dad
was around more?
Yeah.
When he's laying next to me, it's like
we're the exact same person and we do a
lot together and I just miss that so
much. Even holding hands, anything. It's
hard to explain, but it's hard.
